free_text.Content: Topics covered:[br/][li]Biophysical aspects of the tumor microenvironment and the extracellular matrix[br/][li]Tumor cell motility and invasion[br/][li]Tumor immunobioengineering and immunotherapeutic strategies[br/][li]Tissue engineered models of the tumor microenvironment[br/][li]Cancer stem cells, microfluidic devices and high throughput approaches to cancer biology[br/][li]Systems biology in cancer cell cycle signaling[br/][br/]Each participant will be required to participate in weekly class discussion and will be asked to prepare an oral presention during one class per term.[br/][br/]Each participant will be asked to prepare a 3-5 page manuscript by the end of the term critically analyzing a current research article and discussing the results in the context of the emerging field of cancer bioengineering.[br/]
free_text.Required prior knowledge: PhD student with some biology background

free_text.Contenu: Topics covered:[br/][li]Biophysical aspects of the tumor microenvironment and the extracellular matrix[br/][li]Tumor cell motility and invasion[br/][li]Tumor immunobioengineering and immunotherapeutic strategies[br/][li]Tissue engineered models of the tumor microenvironment[br/][li]Cancer stem cells, microfluidic devices and high throughput approaches to cancer biology[br/][li]Systems biology in cancer cell cycle signaling[br/][br/]Each participant will be required to participate in weekly class discussion and will be asked to prepare an oral presention during one class per term.[br/][br/]Each participant will be asked to prepare a 3-5 page manuscript by the end of the term critically analyzing a current research article and discussing the results in the context of the emerging field of cancer bioengineering.
